reviews.review_text: I've enjoyed this episode the most, usually playing the Terra map in order to be able to expand first into an unclaimed territory.   The ability to modify the game text by editing XML has been fun -- part of the enjoyment in both Civ II and Civ IV for me has been editing the resources.  On my platform (Win 7/2.8GHz HP home PC/8 MB RAM), the UI alternates between snappy and very slow. After a while (presumably a memory garbage collection) it gets fast again. Using some of the shortcuts like right-click to move makes the slow-down bearable.
Joesph Stalin and Gandhi fought each other. Gandhi won. Don't ♥♥♥♥ with Gandhi.
Obviously I need to recommend Civ IV; this being the latest.

I played Warlords to death when it was first released. Still have the disks for it somewhere, but I bought the Steam version because on sale for one dollar and thirty seven cents, you cannot go wrong. Warlords add the Mongolians to the Civ world, and they are my favorite because they add greater mobility to the exploration process. Warlords is still very playable, and I had forgotten how good the music is. Compared with Civ V, Warlords is no slouch. It is still beautiful and a pleasure to play. Two thumbs up for this old chestnut.
